item.title: Javascript Dates - Be aware of mutability
item.description: It seems that much like in Java, dates in Javascript are mutable, meaning that it is possible to change a date after it has been created. We had this painfully shown to us when using the datejs library to manipulate some dates. The erroneous code was similar to this: var jan312009 = new Date(2008, 1-1, 31); var oneMonthFromJan312009 = new Date(jan312009.add(1).month()); See the subtle error? Outputting these two values gives the following:
